metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16125 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
gdm3 versions before 3.36.2 or 3.38.2 would start gnome-initial-setup if gdm3 can't contact the accountservice service via dbus in a timely manner; on Ubuntu (and potentially derivatives) this could be be chained with an additional issue that could allow a local user to create a new privileged account.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-16125` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdm3 - 3.38.1-2ubuntu1.1
gir1.2-gdm-1.0 - 3.38.1-2ubuntu1.1
libgdm1 - 3.38.1-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdm3 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.38.1-2ubuntu1.1').
